website_summaries.verdict: This soothing gel keeps eyes moisturized, and acts as a preventative against inflammation and infection. Can ease pet's urge to paw at their eyes by calming discomfort.
pros: Benefits eyes by increasing moisture, which could help prevent irritation and infection
Doesn't contain harsh ingredients or antibiotics
A good choice for cats and dogs that are prone to watery, red, inflamed eyes
Can be used for horses too
cons: Gel-like consistency makes it challenging to apply to some cats' eyes

customer_reviews.title: Our sweet dog suffers from seasonal allergies
customer_reviews.text: Our sweet dog suffers from seasonal allergies, and this year, licked and chewed her paws until a nasty looking granuloma appeared. After spending 3 trips to the animal hospital and $181.00 in antibiotics, anti anxiety, anti fungal, anti microbial and anti itch prescriptions, I tried Vetericyn 2-3 x a day. Within days, the wound began to heal. Within the first week, she stopped licking and chewing and no longer needed a recovery collar. Going on 2 weeks, the granuloma has nearly disappeared.
customer_reviews.author: Juliet

customer_reviews.title: It works!  My dog loves the relief!!
customer_reviews.text: This has been a miracle worker for my precious German Shepherd. He is on Apoquil and still fights hot spots from seasonal allergies in the spring & fall. With this, there is no major spot and no hair loss. When I see him start to have a problem area, I spray this on the skin. It stops the problem. He has gotten such relief, he will come up to me & turn to show me the itchy area to get it sprayed.
customer_reviews.author: Garden Lady

customer_reviews.title: Works ok
customer_reviews.text: Does not work for my pooch. I really was hoping. Update: Since I paid hard earned cash for this product, I continued using on my dog and noted it does help. But the absolute bonus....., I had a flea bite on my foot and it was driving me crazy....I remembered reading that someone said it worked on them, so I tried it! Worked instantly! Haha just wish I could say the same for my dog.
customer_reviews.author: em

customer_reviews.title: I use for indoor and outdoor pets
customer_reviews.text: I use this on my chickens after injuries or frostbite as well as on my inside animals for hot spots. I don’t find they lick at it very much and it’s been really helpful for skin breakdown where my dog has allergies. Also has aided in comb healing on chickens who have gotten rowdy with each other. Has a numbing effect so I use it to numb in conjunction with antibiotic gels to treat small wounds and works great to give me a couple extra seconds to work with the animal so they don’t wrestle me and I can get them treated.
customer_reviews.author: K. Rose Quayle, author of Look Left, Walk Green

customer_reviews.title: Way better than I expected!
customer_reviews.text: My little Pomeranian had a hotspot in the center of her little paw. The vet prescribed some antibiotics but they really didn't help much. This took it to task within a few days. Now the brown stained fur and swelling are gone. I expect only a couple more days of treatment will eliminate the problem. Works on cats and dogs safely and naturally!
customer_reviews.author: AYonko

customer_reviews.title: Worked Wonderfully on my 12 year old Sheltie's Hot Spot
customer_reviews.text: My buddy had a very disturbing open wound hotspot on his butt that was oozing and not very attractive to look at. I trimmed his hair and drained puss and started treating within 2 days he stopped producing the icky stuff and the open wound healed rite up. Highly recommend and will always have a bottle on hand for my Shelties. Only bad is the skirt stopped working so I apply with finger or q-tip
customer_reviews.author: cudaguy

customer_reviews.title: Cleared The Dog's Skin Up In Just A Day!
customer_reviews.text: This Summer has been really hard on my dog, who has some serious skin allergies. After a trip to the vet because he was just tearing himself to pieces, I started using this on his skin whenever he felt itchy or uncomfortable and almost overnight his skin went from enflamed to the nice pale pink it's supposed to be. It calmed right down. I was amazed at how well it seemed to work. It's definitely a product I'll have to keep on hand at all times for future flare ups.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: stops the scratching
customer_reviews.text: I have an older dog. She has hot spots and skin moles. she digs at the moles til she has them bleeding. After applying vetericyn, it pretty much stops the scratching. She freaks out with sprays,so I spray it on cotton balls to apply. I am very satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: My dog class trainer recommended this for a hot spot on my dog's leg (excessive licking after thorn removed) I had tried another ointment and a liquid anti-bacterial/anti-fungal spray but the hot spot persisted. The trainer said she had used this on her horses and then on her dogs, usually seeing results in a day or two. She was right. Two days later, the hot spot was healed enough that my dog couldn't lick it raw again. And yes, I had previously been keeping the area moist and bandaged and treated for several days.
customer_reviews.author: Suzy

customer_reviews.title: seems to be working
customer_reviews.text: One of my Australian Shepards had to go on steroids and antibiotics because of skin allergies. I did not want that to happen again so I decided to try to prevent her skin from getting that bad again. I spray this on her belly twice a day. Her sister also. Their skin seems to be doing fine with this and not getting all red and rashy like they usually do in the hot summers here in the south. I will keep it up. I am always glad to review a product that actually works.
customer_reviews.author: carol

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: My cat Eddie was starting to over-groom and had an irritation that he wouldn't leave alone. After 2 days of using this, the abrasion was gone. Amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Susan M. LabergeTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great product easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product on a recommendation from my vets office and am impressed. Applying it three times a day to area and pups pads are healing nicely. Have also been applying it to a staph infection which is a side effect of the injury and thus far seems to be aiding in the healing process. Would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jmac

customer_reviews.title: Works well on Hot spots
customer_reviews.text: I have a 12 year old Lhasa Apso who suffered so much hot spots on her body. I've tried everything until I've taken her to vet and they've prescribed her meds. However, I ran out and needed to find OTC meds that can give her some relief from scratching all night until she bleeds. I've tried this 3 times a day on her body and she hasn't scratch or bite herself at all. I'd recommend this to use until the scab heals.
customer_reviews.author: Rhea Igarta

customer_reviews.title: Applied properly and I think they sold me straight tap water
customer_reviews.text: It feels like they sold me 3oz of water here, it did nothing at all to help my dog with her hot spots. You spray it on like water, it dries and her skin looked the same. Applied 3x a day and when bottle was empty, my dogs skin still looked the very same.
customer_reviews.author: WaterFrog

customer_reviews.title: Working like a charm
customer_reviews.text: This is working far better than anything I have tried before. My dog bites at his paws a lot for itching. This really works and he doesn't mind the smell near as bad. He has quit running from me.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah C.

customer_reviews.title: This is great!
customer_reviews.text: My cat had a really bad scab on her back due to over grooming from dermatitis. This stuff helped her heal up so fast. A very noticeable difference in only 3 days. My cat hated the process of putting it on but once it was seemed to soothe her. However I would only use this to help heal hot spot wounds not a way to actually treat it.
customer_reviews.author: Barker

customer_reviews.title: sprayer does not work
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with dried product around neck of bottle, cap loose but not leaking in package. Does not spray. Will not use in case it is contaminated or something wrong with product that it wont spray.. it seems that the sprayer is working but product not coming out.
customer_reviews.author: New York

customer_reviews.title: Works for car hot spots
customer_reviews.text: My cat was licking the end of her tail (allergy from outside I think) and it was losing hair and red at the tip. I sprayed on the hot spot multiple times every other day or so for a week or two and it has gotten better grown back hair etc. now I just do it every now and then to ensure healing
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Really small bottle (3 oz.)
customer_reviews.text: I guess I should have read the description more carefully. This is a REALLY small bottIe, just 3 oz. I am keeping it because I need to treat my dog's skin. UPDATE: I used it on his hot spots, a little goes a long way and it worked great!
customer_reviews.author: Chicken Lady

customer_reviews.title: This product does work but takes about a week; treat 3 times a day.
customer_reviews.text: This product has worked very well for helping the recovery of our Yellow Lab from hot spots related to allergies. Trick is to spray on the hot spots before hair loss. Also helps with itching and pain. I use 3 times a day.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Gentle but effective on my kitty's hot spots! She has horrible allergies and this really helps calm the itches!
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Early hot spot treatment might work
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this when my dogs armpit was really enflamed. I do like that it's safe for dogs and I won't have to worry if he licks the area but either it was too severe or the medication itself but I never saw progress. The $7 bottle from the vet helped more.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin S.

customer_reviews.title: Gel plugs up the spray.
customer_reviews.text: Worked well when I first got it but in a few weeks it stopped spraying. Tried cleaning the sprayer part but no luck. Still have more than half left which I cannot use.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Okamura

customer_reviews.title: It seems help my dog wound heal faster
customer_reviews.text: This product is recommended by my other dog owner friend. So far I think it is useful as my dog wound heal faster than before and less moist.
customer_reviews.author: Kay Lam

customer_reviews.title: Worked
customer_reviews.text: The dry spot on our dog is now gone.. she hates getting sprayed but it worked marvelous
customer_reviews.author: Peter V

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: This really seemed to help with our dog's hot spots. I would definitely give it a try if you're looking for something to help your very itchy doggo.
customer_reviews.author: Claire Sperry-Sutfin

customer_reviews.title: Best product!!
customer_reviews.text: This product worked the best on my Golden Retrievers hot spot on her paw. Didn’t hurt her at all and healed her up quickly!
customer_reviews.author: David Breitensten

customer_reviews.title: No difference from regular kind
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed to see the only differences between this and the regular stuff are the red stripe on the label and the price. All the ingredients are the same. Save yourself the money and purchase the regular kind!
customer_reviews.author: Abbey Apple Seed

customer_reviews.title: Gives pet relief
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product to relieve itching due to rashes & hot spots. Makes a big difference in our Chihuahua.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Not sure this works at all?
customer_reviews.text: Are black lab develop hot spots a few months ago. Thought we would give this a try. Didn't seem to do much to alleviate the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Kirby

customer_reviews.title: Good stops itch with out tingling
customer_reviews.text: Good stops itch with out tingling which can really bother or annoy bunnies wet ears and meds annoy them but I took a cotton ball and he experienced relief moments after. Def would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Aquadad & Mermaid Girl

customer_reviews.title: I’m impressed
customer_reviews.text: This has helped my poor pup when nothing else has. Vet products, antibiotics, other brands.
customer_reviews.author: reddog

customer_reviews.title: this works...
customer_reviews.text: Shipper inquired if I received item..... yes.... Vetrecyn is part of my emergency plan.
customer_reviews.author: DR Fontes

customer_reviews.title: ok
customer_reviews.text: used on our Labs hot spot... she licks it off. took awhile to get rid of hot spot. so i guess it helped
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie J. Quinlan

customer_reviews.title: Can use for a number of irritation and rashes.
customer_reviews.text: My dog gets redness and swelling between the pads of her feet and it helps to relieve these symptoms.. I've even put a squirt or two on my foot fungus and it makes it quit itching and peeling.
customer_reviews.author: Eva Rampy

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Good product, arrived as promised. Works well on our dog's hot spots.
customer_reviews.author: Paul S

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic! My girl had chewed a sore and I used this for a week and it cleared right up.
customer_reviews.author: zendid

customer_reviews.title: Works well but sprayer not good
customer_reviews.text: Worked well. However, the pump spray stopped working while it was 1/2 full. Don't spray it upside down or it will stop spraying and I couldn't get it to work again.
customer_reviews.author: Roberta Townsend

customer_reviews.title: Sorry,
customer_reviews.text: I wrote a review, but failed to check off the rating. It isn't a 1, it's a 5 star . Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Does nothing
customer_reviews.text: I used this on our dog who chews on her feet and legs constantly. It did nothing to improve her situation, even after multiple uses.
customer_reviews.author: stpauldogs

customer_reviews.title: Cleared up my dogs hot spot
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing. It worked within just a few days and my dogs very bad hot spot was gone!! This means no vet trip And I ordered another bottle to keep on hand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My dog was chewing her feet. Spraying her feet with this product has helped so much.
customer_reviews.author: G Reyher

customer_reviews.title: Works fast and easy to use!!!
customer_reviews.text: Cleared up the spot in three days!! Used one to two times a day and didnt affect puppy at all!!
customer_reviews.author: AmandaC05

customer_reviews.title: A mild gel that works
customer_reviews.text: Scentless and mild, but very effective. Remember to reapply it.
customer_reviews.author: Mariam

customer_reviews.title: Must have fir any animal or bird
customer_reviews.text: Great product fir wounds. Easy to apply and stays put
customer_reviews.author: June M.

customer_reviews.title: Works great,
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! Product seems to be helping already! Its a must have for all the wound , hot spot & allergies.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Easy to apply for my dog. Helps with clearing up hot spots.
customer_reviews.author: Dewawn Butler

customer_reviews.title: Good medication!
customer_reviews.text: Works well shows results in week’s time . Pls wipe your dog’s feet before applying vetericyn spray ! 3 times a day
customer_reviews.author: Vishal

customer_reviews.title: My Bad
customer_reviews.text: Totally my fault for not enlarging the picture. I had no idea it was only a 3oz bottle for $17.00! Won't do that again.
customer_reviews.author: Linda N.

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: I started using it on my dog and within days I saw an improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Lulu walker

customer_reviews.title: Works quickly and safely!
customer_reviews.text: Helps my dog heal quickly from hotspots. Doesn't hurt or sting.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Helped my pup
customer_reviews.text: I never tasted it but it don't have an odor. It asked for a flavor rating hmmmm
customer_reviews.author: Maria Tussing

customer_reviews.title: My dog liked it!
customer_reviews.text: This helped my dog so much that she looked forward to getting sprayed when she had a few spots on her belly.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Bottle received half full
customer_reviews.text: Just arrived half full. Not a full bottle. It appears to have spilled. Going to keep it though as I need it to use on my dog
customer_reviews.author: Zully Brewer

customer_reviews.title: Miracle in a bottle!!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use...cleared up my Bull mastiffs dreaded hot spot! In a week Need to apply 2 to 3 times a day but well worth it!!
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My guinea pig didnt mind it seems to be helping
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: small bottle
customer_reviews.text: Good product but this is 3 oz and 8 oz is only a few more dollars.
customer_reviews.author: J. Nagela

product_meta.title: Vetericyn Plus Hot Spot Antimicrobial Pet Hydrogel
product_meta.description: Size:3 oz[Made in the USA] Vetericyn Plus Hot Spot Antimicrobial Hydrogel is designed to adhere to the animal’s hot spot or sore to provide soothing relief and protection during healing. All Vetericyn Plus products are made with hypochlorous technology, a non-toxic alternative to antibiotics and steroids for a safer way to relieve skin ailments and jumpstart the healing process. The unique hydrogel does not cause irritation to the skin and is safe for use in sensitive areas or with a dressing, like gauze, to keep the wound moist.
feature_bullets: ALL ANIMAL HOT SPOT HYDROGEL. (Packaging/Bottle Color May Vary) Provide safe and effective relief for your pets irritations, abrasions and other skin issues with this hydrogel. Approved for use on all animals, from cats and dogs to horses and livestock.
PAIN-FREE SOLUTION. Apply the hydrogel to the clean, affected area 3-4 times per day or as necessary. It adheres to the skin for immediate soothing relief and helps speed up healing.

RECOMMENDED BY VETERINARIANS. Save yourself the expense of a trip to the vet with solutions your animal care provider would recommend. From your home to the farm or ranch, care for your animals where they are happy and comfortable.

INNOVATIVE, RELIABLE ANIMAL HEALTHCARE PRODUCTS. Vetericyn is committed to developing the most safe, effective and innovative animal health and wellness products in the world. Each one is produced with scientific research and a standard of excellence.

STANDARDS YOU CAN TRUST. All products are manufactured under strict international guidelines and in an FDA-registered, state-of-the-art facility in the USA. Parent company Innovacyn, Inc. is family-owned and operated since 2009 in Rialto, CA.
